tribe_name: Northern Arapaho Tribe of the Wind River Reservation, Wyoming

awards.description: IMPLEMENTING THE SUSTAINABLE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBAL CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCE PROJECT FOR A CLIMATE CHANGE, WEATHER READY AND RESILIENT COMMUNITY

DESCRIPTION:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER AN EPA PROGRAM AND/OR IMPLEMENT SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE ACTIVITIES. 
ACTIVITIES:THE GAP FUNDS WILL PAY FOR AN ENVIRONMENTAL ASSISTANT WHO WILL BE IN CHARGE OF THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:

- SERVE AS THE POINT OF CONTACT WITH EPA ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND COORDINATE WITH OTHER STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES RESPONSIBLE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT ON THE RESERVATION. - ANSWER CALLS, RESPOND TO INQUIRIES AND COMPLAINTS, REVIEW CORRESPONDENCE AND REPORTS.
- COORDINATE WITH THE WIND RIVER INTERTRIBAL COUNCIL ON SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL MATTERS, KEEP WRITC INFORMED ON NANRO ACTIVITIES.
- COORDINATE ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS AND GRANTS, INCLUDING NAT'S EPA CPRG. PROJECT.
- PREPARE 4 QUARTERLY REPORTS WITHIN 30 DAYS OF END OF QUARTER TO UPDATE GAP ACTIVITIES AND STATUS. 
- COORDINATE WITH THE NAT FINANCE OFFICE TO ENSURE FISCAL MANAGEMENT, REPORTING, AND COMPLIANCE.
- COORDINATE AND ACCOMPANY EPA ENFORCEMENT STAFF ON INSPECTIONS OF NAT FACILITIES, INCLUDING NPDES, SPCC, SDWA, AND AIR QUALITY PERMIT INSPECTIONS. FOLLOW-UP ON ANY INSPECTION FINDINGS AND ASSIST OTHER TRIBAL ENTITIES WITH COMPLIANCE ISSUES.
- RESPOND TO ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLAINTS SUCH AS SPILLS AND ILLEGAL DUMPING AND REFER TO APPROPRIATE AGENCIES
- PREPARE A LIST OF SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT NEEDS FOR NAT AND RESEARCH FUNDING SOURCES. COORDINATE WITH THE WRITC ON WASTE MANAGEMENT ISSUES AFFECTING THE WIND RIVER RESERVATION. 
- REVIEW AND COMMENT ON CWA CERTIFICATIONS AND USACE PERMITS FOR PROJECTS THAT AFFECT WATERWAYS ON THE RESERVATION. RESPOND TO INFORMATION REQUESTS.



SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:
- KEEP DAILY LOGS OF CORRESPONDENCE AND ACTIVITIES. REPORT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.
- REPORT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.
- REPORT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.
- SUBMIT 4 QUARTERLY STATUS REPORTS TO EPA. COPY TO NABC AND WRITC.
- FISCAL MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING AS REQUIRED BY GRANT TERMS AND CONDITIONS
- REPORT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.
- DOCUMENT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.
- DOCUMENT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS. PROVIDE WRITTEN NAT SWM PLAN OUTLINE TO EPA WITH LONG-TERM AND SHORT-TERM GOALS.
- DOCUMENT ACTIVITIES IN QUARTERLY REPORTS.



THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS AND COMPLIANCE WITHIN ALL NAT ENTITIES.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE MEMBERS AND/OR RESIDENTS OF THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE.

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
